subject: AI & Agents
title: The Objectivity Illusion
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Objectivity Illusion.

hook.text: People trust AI decisions because machines seem objective. But objectivity is an illusion.

buildup.text: Every AI system reflects choices: what data to use, what to optimize, whose values to encode.

discovery.text: A recidivism prediction tool rated Black defendants as higher risk. The data reflected systemic inequity.

twist.text: Calling AI 'objective' launders human biases through a machine, making them harder to challenge.

climax.text: The most dangerous myth is that algorithms are neutral. They encode the priorities of their creators.

punchline.text: There's no view from nowhere. Not even for machines.

quiz.question: Why is the idea that AI is 'objective' dangerous?
options: It disguises human biases as neutral machine decisions
Objectivity is never a concern in AI
